newsitem.title: USA: Airborne Express launches PC-based software.
newsitem.headline: Airborne Express launches PC-based software.

text.p: Airborne Express said it has introduced "Lightship Shipper", new PC-based shipping software allowing customers full access of information regarding their shipping history and costs.

It said the new software enables customers to obtain estimated rates and delivery times, fill out airway bills, schedule freight collections and track the status of multiple shipments anywhere in the world.

The capabilities offered by "Lightship Shipper" were only previously made available by the carrier's "Libra Two" system, which Jill Gwazdauskas, Airborne vice-president customer automation, said is probably still best for a company shipping hundreds of packages per week.
"The beauty of the 'Shipper' software is that anybody can use it, whether they send one package a day or dozens," Gwazdauskas said.
The initial release of the software package follows nine months of development, which included gathering customer feedback and the study of existing shipping programmes, the carrier said.
The software, currently available on a limited basis, is free of charge. Airborne said it will be available to every customer by autumn 1997.
